definition: to pool resources (for a gift, project etc)
to gather together, pool or collect/to happen by chance/to move close to/to exploit an opportunity
classifier for gifts, newspaper, magazine, papers, reports, contracts etc/variant of 分[fen4]

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: Students often go Dutch in these restaurants on weekends.
sentences.chinese: 週末，學生常湊份子去這些飯館喫飯。

sentences.english: We had a whip-round for Annie's leaving present.
sentences.chinese: 我們湊份子給安妮買了離別禮物。

sentences.english: Let us do a whip-round to buy a joint present for Mary's birthday?
sentences.chinese: 我們一起湊份子給瑪麗買份生日禮物吧？
